item.title: Understanding Backtracking
item.description: Recursion black magic While working through some HackerRank’s problems, I came across the following exercise: Find the number of ways that a given integer, \(X\), can be expressed as the sum of the \(N^{th}\) powers of unique, natural numbers. However, I could not inmediately come up with a compelling way to programatically enumerate and examine all the possible sequences of numbers to find the required solution. Thus, it’s good time as ever to refresh my knowledge about recursion and specically, backtracking.
